message: A frigid wind blows through my hair.
Red earth extends as far as the eye could see, covered with lush forests and rugged mountains.
The sky is dyed in the colors of sunrise. It looks like something out of a picture book.
I'm finally here.
After leaving Midorijima, I traveled the world searching for him.
I only had the images from his memories to go by, but still I searched far and wide.
Finally, after what seemed an eternity, I discovered where he was.
He was alive.
When I found out, I nearly wept for joy.
I raced to the location... but by the time I got there, he was gone.
Of course he was. He'd left behind everything he'd known. He had no intention of seeing anyone from his past again.
Not his gang members, and definitely not me.
But I didn't give up.
If he ran, I'd chase him and chase him and chase him...
I knew it was crazy.
But as ridiculous as it was, I was certain I would find him.
I never even considered the possibility of failure.
And now...
...I'm looking right at it.
I'm seeing what he saw that night in Glitter, when he was staring off into the distance.
I've never seen it before, but it feels so familiar. Probably because I spent so much time looking for it.
Finally, I have an answer to one of the questions that has haunted me since that night.
But this is just the beginning. There's so much more I want to know.
...You're the one who told me that I'm the one who decides what I do.
So it's not about what you want. I'm here because I want to be.
I'm not letting you escape again.
Long hair streams gently in the wind. Through some trick of the sun, it looks almost golden.
The man turns at the sound of my footsteps.
From his shoulder, his erstwhile partner takes wing.
Now his eyes gleam golden like the rising sun.
From the look on his face, I can tell he knew I was coming.
...I wonder if he showed himself to me on purpose.
Tears well up in my eyes.
As different as he looks, I know it's him. The real him.

Nothing to hide, no lies...

Just him.
I'm so glad I didn't give up.
I'm so glad I believed in myself.
I'm so glad I believed...<K> in him.
I run to him, across the beautiful hills of his home.
I run, for he is no less beautiful.
Your life isn't over. Not yet.
I'm here to tell you that this is a new beginning.
A beginning... <?>
we'll share together.
